thread.title: Parker: Grandpa was "launched" from bed when car crashed into home
thread.title_full: Parker: Grandpa was "launched" from bed when car crashed into home - The Denver Post

author: Kirk Mitchell
title: Parker: Grandpa was "launched" from bed when car crashed into home
text:
A 70-year-old grandfather was hurt early Monday after a car "flew" over his front yard and collided with the brick wall of his bedroom, launching him and his bed across the room.
The driver, who is suspected of speeding and drunken driving, also sustained non-life-threatening injuries.
The abrupt awakening happened shortly before 4 a.m., according to Lori Bronner, spokeswoman for the Douglas County Sheriff's Office.
The driver, who hasn't been identified, was apparently speeding when he swerved around a corner on the 5200 block of Nashua Circle, careened off the pavement, hit a berm and went airborne, Bronner said.
The car struck a tree in midair before crashing into a brick wall where the 70-year-old man was sleeping.
The concussion "launched" the man's bed and him across his bedroom.
"It's not the way I'd like to wake up," Bronner said.
The sheriff's office received a call at 3:57 a.m., she said.
The driver and the homeowner, who has not been named, were taken in ambulances to separate hospitals, she said.
Kirk Mitchell: 303-954-1206, kmitchell@denverpost.com or @kirkmitchell or denverpost.com/coldcases
